text:
Hey sorry 
Was working yesterday so couldn’t reply 
I’m doing great thank you :)
No need to apologise :slightly_smiling_face:
Are you using object oriented concepts or are your tools procedural ?
Oh hey
He he
Not too sure, I believe object orientated though

Ahh what I mean is 
Are you writing classes or mostly just functions ?
If you are writing class definitions and using objects of those class types then that would be Object oriented
But if it’s mostly just functions that you run in sequence , that’s procedural
It’s not wrong and required in a lot of places
ah I see then it would be procedural since I just write functions
are there examples of when one type is better to use than another?
But being able to write and use classes is a handy skill to have especially if you want to get into making a UI and all that :)
Oh cool, I’ve been taking some classes on sololearn about python and just reached the lesson about classes

So usually we use classes and objects when you have different entities that do different things 
Like for example , in maya 
You have joints , polygons , locator and all these different types of objects
Under the hood they are defined as classes that have a clearly defined set of operations that they can do

Ahh nice 
Yeah pay attention to classes and how to use them
Yeah I think the tool I have made so far is very diy. It works but not very professional so would like to streamline it in both performance and appearance
It’ll also help you manage your code better
would the code for creating windows be in a class?
I’d be happy to take a look at the code and make suggestions if it’s  on git hub :)

So for creating good UI
You can use the Py Qt libraries
That’s been the industry standard for a while now
And yes you will be dealing with a lot of classes
It’s very well documented
Awesome I’d greatly appreciate that, will have to put it onto git hub, and there are lots of errors with it as of right now I’m sure

Nah don’t worry about it 
It’ll give a good idea about what to suggest
*give me
Thanks! Going to upload to git Hub ASAP

Cool :) My email id is 
<mailto:Sachin.narendra@gmail.com|Sachin.narendra@gmail.com> 
You can send the link there
Ok think I’ve uploaded it to git hub correctly
Email sent hopefully I’ve done it all correctly, not used git hub before
I set the viewing mode to private but should I have made it public?
I can’t seem to view the code :thinking_face:

It allowed you to set it to private 
That’s weird 
Thought you needed a paid subscription to do that
I found your account though
Says 0 repositories
I can set it to public if that would help
or should I set you as a contributor? Not sure which one is better
If you don’t want to make it public then you can add me as a collaborator
Either is fine by me
I’ll do that, are you just Sachin on there?
SachinNarendra
thank you! Believe I have just sent a collab request
Checking one sec
no worries

Yup got it ! 
Will have a look in the next couple of days if that’s ok :)
thats absolutely fine!

Ok first rule of programming 
No spaces in file names :grimacing:
He he he
ah understood!
If I was to work and update the file then reupload to git hub could I version it up? So you know which one is the latest file?
Oh so git will keep track of that history for you
Lemme show you
One sec
ok thank you
So I just renamed the file and made a commit ( I’m assuming you are not familiar with git so you may not be familiar with that term )
Git basically allows you to manage your code without you having to do any version controlling
It stores the difference in the code as you go along so at any point you can step back in time
oh wow thats awesome

It’s quite powerful 
Check out the guide available on github and see if that makes sense
Feel free to ask me  questions if something is not clear :)
Are you on windows or Linux/Mac
I’m using a mac, but at uni i try to use linux as much as possible
They are both more or less the same for our purpose so it’s cool :)
also just opened up the file and its showing me something which I’m a little confused about, could I send a screenshot?
oh nevermind reopened it again and its gone
What you can do is install git on your machine and there is an option to clone(make a local copy) of  this new repository (code base) you have created and use git commands to manage your changes
Ah I see, I will have to try that, I usually just code within the Maya script editor which I know isn’t ideal

That’s totally ok as long as you copy your stuff into a file and keep committing changes 
That way you have a history of all your changes 
Let’s take it slow 
I can help you with this stuff next weekend :)
thank you very much

For now Just google 
Install git on Mac 
And see if you can have that installed
On your machine
ok I’ll attempt that now
No problem at all :)
so when working on code, do you often test it within Maya?
also is it ok to install github desktop? or should I be looking for something else
Always test in maya if it’s got maya related functionality
ah makes sense
The only difference would be that I wouldn’t have all the code in the script editor
would you call it from sys? or something like that?
It would live in a python module that I install in some predefined location that I make maya aware of and then just import the functions I want to call
ah I see, and calling the function is only when testing?
What you can do is create a directory where your install code to ( different form the directory where your repository is )
I can show you all of that stuff next week
thank you!
I’ll add some files in your repo to give you an idea
oh awesome thank you! I’ll hopefully get to do a bit more work on the tool this week but a bit unsure as I have other things that I’ve gotta get done
See if uuu can install just git
Lot of the studios just have the command line interface of git
I have installed github desktop and I now have an option to clone my repository

No worries 
We can take it slow 
Once concept per week 
Focus on what you need to
thank you
what concept should I focus on this week>

See if you have git on your Mac already by typing 
git - - version
In the terminal
oh ok

If you don’t then find a way to get that 
Google is your friend for that :)
says there is git version 2.21.1
And then see if you can learn about the most common git commands like
Ah sweet
So you already have it
oh nice!

See if you can learn to use the common commands like 

git clone 
git branch
git checkout 
git commit 
git push 
git pull
Take your time and we can catch up next weekend and see where you are stuck
ok cool thank you
I’ll be sure to write those down somewhere and try to learn them

Again 
Google and stack overflow are your friends :blush:
so since git is already on mac is there way to use it to access the repository we have?
Ah stack overflow, I have found myself on there a few times

Yup 
If you look at the riggingTool page on git hub
looking at it now
You should see a big green button on the right hand side
the clone or download one
Yes exactly
Click on that and you will get a link
ah okay
Copy that
yep
In the terminal , pick a directory where you would like to store all your code ( make one if you don’t have one already )
And then navigate to that directory in the terminal
would it be using git-dir=<path>?
You familiar with command line ?
not very sorry

No worries 
That’s probably something you want to get used to
absolutely
So to navigate

You can use 

cd ~/my_git_repos
Assuming you have a directory by that name

If you don’t 
You can create it using 

mkdir my_git_repos
ok I’ll try to make that
And then run the previous command
would linux also have git built in?
oooh ok that seems to be working!
If it’s at your unit they may have installed it
*uni
So now if you ran the cd  command I mentioned earlier you should be inside the directory you just created
yep I appear to be so

There you can run 
git clone <link you copied earlier>
I have added a link to the readme file that should help you with the most common git commands
so I have ran that then logged into github and it appears to have unpacked the objects
oh and thank you!

So now if you run the command 
tree 
In the same terminal
It should list the files under there
Do you see two files ?
not yet, typing tree but it says command not found
Ahh
It’s Mac right

Try 

ls
yes
sorry for the confusion!
it shows me riggingTool

Cool 
Now 
Go into that directory using the cd command
And then run ls
Ah sweet!
So you see the two files ?
yes I do now
That basically now linked to your repo on git hub

If you open the readme 
Do you see a link in there ?
Use any text editor you have to open the file
its showing me #riggingTool in the editor
also just figured out how to open files from the terminal!
Cool that means you cloned it just before I made the change

If you run 

git pull
It should update your local repo
oh wow thats so cool!
yep there is now a link!
Now if you type a message in that read me

Like 
I’ve seen this or something
And save the file
yep added a line and saved

Now in the terminal run 
git diff
That should show you the lines you have added or modified
oh sweet it does!

And 
git status
Should list all the files that were modified
yep!
is there a way that uploads the changes back to git hub?
What that means is you have some changes that you have made but it’s still not recorded
To record the changes

You have to run the 
git commit
And a shortcut is
git commit -am “some meaningful message”
That will record the changes
Locally

If you then run 
git push 
And refresh your page on git hub you should see the change you made
trying to commit and writing a message but cant seem to confirm it
I’m assuming you didn’t use the -am shortcut :)
i typed -a
is there a way to reload the terminal?

Right 
So -a just adds all the changes
In that case you probably see a prion or to add a message
oh I see
After you enter the message

Hit the escape key 
Forllowed by : 
And the the letters 
wq
And enter
I think I’ve done something wrong

The letters
wq 
Imply 
Write and quit
Ahh
What do you see ?

Right 
What you want to do first is 
Go to the first line
Any line that starts with # will be ignored and not part of the message
So you want to type the message on the first line without the #

If this is too confusing 
I’d suggest using the shortcut I mentioned earlier

Hit the escape key 
Forllowed by : 
And the the letters 
wq
Ok will have to test on a moment just on way home but when I get there I’ll try it out
Cool no worries
Thanks!
cool it all works now!
just updated the files on git hub
